treks.title: Gosaikunda Pass Trekking
treks.short_description: Trek to the holiest alpine lake in Hindu culture at 4,312m with stunning glacier-carved valley views, sacred pilgrimage significance, and abundant wildlife in Langtang National Park.
treks.review_text: A challenging yet rewarding trek combining natural heritage with religious pilgrimage to Nepal's most sacred alpine lake.

hero_section.title: Gosaikunda Pass Trekking
hero_section.subtitle: Sacred Alpine Lake - Where Earth Touches Heaven at 4,312m

sections.heading: Gosaikunda Pass Trekking Overview
articles: Gosaikunda Lake is the holiest lake in Hindu culture situated at 4,312m elevation, believed to have originated from the digging of earth by Lord Shiva's Trishul (holy three-pointed sword). According to legend, a black rock in the lake's middle is the head of Lord Shiva. Thousands of Hindu pilgrims visit during the full moon festival in August (Janai Purnima). This 11-day trek combines natural heritage with glacial landscapes, intense forests with wildflowers, animal species, and heart-touching natural scenery. The route passes through oak and rhododendron forests, crosses glacial moraines, and encounters typical Tamang villages in Langtang National Park.

bullets.text: Sacred Gosaikunda Lake: 4,312m elevation - holiest alpine lake in Hindu culture
Challenging trek requiring good physical fitness and acclimatization
Thousands of pilgrims visit during August full moon festival (Janai Purnima)

itinerary_days.title: Arrival in Kathmandu & Rest
itinerary_days.description: Arrive at Tribhuwan International Airport. EverTrek Nepal representative welcomes and transfers to Thamel district hotel for acclimatization and trek preparation.

itinerary_days.title: Drive Kathmandu to Syabrubesi
itinerary_days.description: Early morning departure from Kathmandu. Drive 120+ km north through terraced farmlands and picturesque villages following the Trishuli River valley.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Syabrubesi to Thulo Syabru
itinerary_days.description: First trekking day through scenic terraced farmlands and forests alongside Langtang River. Encounter traditional villages and local agricultural practices.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Thulo Syabru to Singompa
itinerary_days.description: Trek to Singompa (also called Cholangpati) at 3,250m. Visit Buddhist monastery and explore yak cheese factory. Ascending through alpine forests with mountain vistas emerging.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Singompa to Gosaikunda Lake
itinerary_days.description: Challenging ascent through subtropical forest transitioning to alpine zone with beautiful rhododendron, oak, pine, and birch forests. Reach the sacred Gosaikunda Lake at 4,312m.

itinerary_days.title: Acclimatization Day - Gosaikunda Exploration
itinerary_days.description: Full day acclimatization at the sacred lake. Explore surrounding alpine lakes (Saraswati Kund, Bhairav Kund, Surya Kund). Receive blessings and observe religious ceremonies at this pilgrimage site.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Gosaikunda to Laurebina Pass Descent
itinerary_days.description: Most challenging day crossing Gosaikunda Pass (Laurebina La) at 4,610m with panoramic Himalayan views. Trek to Ghopte at 3,430m entering Helambu region.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Ghopte to Kutumsang
itinerary_days.description: Continue descent through beautiful alpine forest with further wildlife spotting opportunities. Trek through Pati Pass with stunning mountain and valley views below.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Kutumsang to Chisapani
itinerary_days.description: Descent through meadows and forests to Chisapani village. Ascend to dusty wide road and continue on steep rocky path through Gul Bhanjyang to Chisapani.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Chisapani to Sundarijal & Drive to Kathmandu
itinerary_days.description: Final short descent to Sundarijal through beautiful forests and valleys. 1-hour drive back to Kathmandu. Celebration dinner with trekking crew marking trek completion.

itinerary_days.title: Departure Day
itinerary_days.description: Rest day in Kathmandu. Free time for shopping, cultural activities, or optional city tour. Prepare for departure to airport based on flight schedule.

highlights.title: Sacred Gosaikunda Lake - Religious Pilgrimage Site
highlights.description: Visit Nepal's holiest alpine lake at 4,312m believed to have originated from Lord Shiva's Trishul. Explore surrounding sacred lakes (Saraswati Kund, Bhairav Kund, Surya Kund). Witness thousands of Hindu pilgrims during August full moon festival (Janai Purnima) making this a unique spiritual experience.

highlights.title: Laurebina Pass Crossing - High Pass Adventure
highlights.description: Cross Gosaikunda Pass (Laurebina La) at 4,610m, the route's highest and most challenging point with panoramic 360-degree Himalayan views. Experience views of Langtang Lirung (7,246m), Ganesh Himal, Manaslu, and on clear days, the Annapurna range.

highlights.title: Tamang Culture & Hospitality - Mountain Communities
highlights.description: Trek through pristine rhododendron and oak forests to encounter typical Tamang villages and their authentic mountain lifestyle. Stay in family-run teahouses and experience Sherpa and Tamang communities' unique traditions, cuisine, and warm hospitality.

highlights.title: Glacial Landscapes & Alpine Ecosystems
highlights.description: Pass through glacial moraine terrain and observe dramatic glacier-carved valley landscapes unique to the Langtang region. Explore intense forests teeming with wildflowers, rare alpine flora, and diverse fauna including red pandas, musk deer, and Himalayan wildlife.

cost.title: What's Included & What's Excluded
cost_inclusions: TIMS Card and Langtang National Park permit
All meals during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Hotel accommodation in Kathmandu (nights before and after trek)

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Gosaikunda Pass Trekking is best done September-November (Autumn) for clear skies and March-May (Spring) for stunning rhododendron blooms. All prices are per person and vary by group size. Private group departures on preferred dates available upon request. Early booking essential for peak seasons.

date_highlights.highlight: August Janai Purnima (full moon) - thousands of pilgrims visit
Clear mountain views and stable weather autumn

questions.question: Is Gosaikunda Pass Trekking suitable for beginners?
questions.answer: Gosaikunda is moderately challenging and best suited for trekkers with good fitness and previous trekking experience. The high altitude and challenging pass crossing require proper acclimatization and mental preparation.

questions.question: How do I prevent altitude sickness?
questions.answer: Proper acclimatization is key. We include rest days and gradual ascents. Drink 3-4 liters of water daily, avoid alcohol, ascend slowly, and consult your doctor about altitude sickness medication.

questions.question: What is the best time to trek?
questions.answer: Autumn (September-November) for clear views and stable weather, and Spring (March-May) for rhododendron blooms. August draws pilgrims for Janai Purnima full moon festival.

additional_info_sections.heading: Important Notes
articles: Gosaikunda Pass Trekking is a challenging high-altitude trek that requires good physical fitness and previous trekking experience. Medical consultation before trek is essential.
The full moon festival (Janai Purnima) in August draws thousands of pilgrims. If trekking during this time, expect crowded trails and book accommodations well in advance.
Proper acclimatization and slow pace are critical for safe passage over Laurebina La Pass.

bullets.text: Good fitness required - previous trekking experience essential
Medical insurance and altitude sickness medication recommended
High pass (4,610m) crossing most challenging section
